fields.title: Staff Subject List
fields.text:
Table

Name: Subject's full name.

Student ID: Subject's student id number.

Earnings: Earnings in USD up to this point in the experiment.

Avatar: The avatar the subject has.  This will fill in as subjects choose an avatar.

Town: Up to three towns can be in operation at once.

Location: Subject's location within the town starting with 1 is on the top left, 4 on the bottom left, 5 top right and 8 is the bottom right.

Client #:  Each client is numbered from 1 to 24.

Group: Current group the subject is in.  Subjects can only see subjects in their own group.

Label: Subject's in-experiment id visible to other subjects.

Type: One of the four different subject types.

First Good House: Amount of first good subject has in their house.

Second Good House: Amount of second good subject has in their house.

Third Good House: Amount of third good subject has in their house if applicable.

First Good Field: Amount of first good subject has in their field.

Second Good Field: Amount of second good subject has in their field.

Shareable Log In Link: Unique link that can be shared with subjects to log in as this client.

Connected: Connection status of client to the experiment.

Instruction: During the instruction phase, shows current instruction status for the subject.

 

Login

Next available connection: Log in as the next available client that has not Connected.  Note that a subject could log in multiple times by opening this link in multiple windows. This link will auto-forward to the Shareable Log In Link defined above.

Login by client number: Log in as specified client by number.  Replace "[client_number]" in the link with the desired client number ranging from 1 to 24.  Note that subject could log in as any client by changing the client_number. This link will auto-forward to the Shareable Log In Link defined above.

fields.title: Staff Graph
fields.text:
Town

Each subject has a house, field, and optionally an avatar.  Goods grow on their filed and are consumed in their house.  Chat appears in the center.  The visible town can be changed in the bottom right corner of the frame.

fields.title: Staff Control
fields.text:
Start Session: Starts the session, the subject screens will switch to the first phase of the experiment.

Reset Connection Status: Sets all client connection status to "disconnected".  Note that this will not disconnect any connected clients this only changes the status.  This will re-open all clients to auto connection.

Reset Experiment:  Remove all data and reset the experiment back to the pre-start state.

Show Instructions: Once all subjects have picked an avatar, show the experiment instructions.  If subjects are not picking an avatar, the instructions will show when the Start Session button is pressed.

Start Experiment: Once all subjects have completed the instructions, start the experiment.  The instructions will be hidden and the first period will start.

Start/Stop Timer: Once the experiment is started, press the Start Timer button to begin the clock.  The clock runs inside the connection for the browser tab that pressed the Start Timer button.  If that browser tab is refreshed or loses connection with the server the clock will stop.  If this happens, press Stop Timer and then Start Timer to resume from the point the clock stopped.

fields.title: Staff Parameters General
fields.text:
Number of Towns:  Number of different towns in use during this session.

Number of Goods: Number of goods types in the session.

Number of Periods: Number of periods, each consisting of a production and move phase.

Production Length: Number of seconds fields will spend producing goods.

Move Length: Number of seconds subjects will have to move goods around the environment. 

Break Period Frequency: Every N periods nothing is produced on fields but the chat rooms are open.

Allow Stealing: Allow subjects to move items from houses or fields belonging to others.

Private Chat: Enable one-on-one chat within a subject's group.

Show Avatars: Show avatars next to the fields.

Avatar Assignment

  • None: Avatars are not used.
  • Pre-assigned: Subjects will have the avatar defined in the parameters.
  • Subject Select: Subjects will have the avatar they pick.
  • Best Match: Subjects will have the avatar they pick and will be assigned to a client that is similar to their choice.

Avatar Grid Row/Col: Size of the avatar choice grid shown to the subjects.

Show Instructions: Enable the instruction phase

Instruction Set: The Instruction set shown to the subject.  Instruction sets are editable in the admin screen.

Test Mode: Run the software with bots taking random actions during the sesssion.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Avatars
fields.text: The layout of the avatar choice grid.  Exceeding 5 rows will result in scrolling.  Avatar images are defined on the admin screen.  Images must be added to the Github repo as well as the avtars.png sprite sheet.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Goods
fields.text: The label and hex RGB code of the three goods.  The third good will be ignored if not needed.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Players
fields.text:
Town: The town the client resides in.

Location: Locations start with 1 on the top left and go down along the left side.  Then starts again with location 5 on the top right and goes down again.  Not all locations need to be filled.

Label: Label that will appear next to the client's house, field, avatar, and chat.

Type: The player type for this client.

First Good: The client's first good.

Second Good: The client's second good.    

Third Good: The client's third good.     

Avatar: The client's pre-assigned avatar if needed.

Groups: The client's group in that period. Clients can only interact with other clients in their current group.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Types
fields.text:
Subjects are assigned to be one of 4 types.

Subject fields will produce goods based on the production settings.  Subjects will split their production time between producing the 2 goods.

Example:

The subject set 60% good one and 40% good two. 

The total production time is 10 (from General Settings).

The Time parameter for good one production is 6.

The Time parameter for good two productions is 4.

Goods in a subject's house at the end of the period will earn US cents based on the rates defined earnings section.
